hint.text:
Acceleration = Rate of change of speed
Speed = \( \frac{distance}{time} \)

solution.text:
None of the above
At constant acceleration, Speed is not a constant.
Therefore, \( \frac{distance}{time} \neq \) constant(k)
Hence, they are not directly proportional nor are they constant.

content.text: The quantities distance and time (t\( \neq \) 0), when acceleration is a constant k,(k\( \neq \) 0) are ___________.
